Title: Logan & Willow - The book
Excerpt:
This year my wife and I felt the need to work on a shared project.  What could be better than a projet about our son?  
So we came out with this crazy idea of writing a *children's book*.

Take a look at the story of **Logan and Willow**!

Updates.Title: Sketched and checked!
Updates.Content:
I love word play.

Being more serious, we finished what I could call the storyboard! We did premilinary sketches of all the story (which is fully written).

Next step: start actual drawings or visual search.

Title: Little Chef Logan
Excerpt:
There are many ways to spend your time. But what I think is one of the best: *familly time*.  
That should definitively <u>not</u> stop you from doing something else also.

As I *love* my son, and as I love cooking, what should I do? Well do both obviously!  
That's how **Little Chef Logan** was born: I wanted to enjoy spending time with him and take time to cook. I wanted to share some stuff I can do with my 2 years old son at cooking!

Updates.Title: Settling on video edit
Updates.Content:
I've been putting this project aside for some time now for a various of bad reasons.

From the first list of recipes I should do for this series, I've filmed 5 out of 10. Some of the remaining recipes should be done sometime else (red fruits or tomato in winter? Nope).

From these filmed cooking sessions, I've struggled to get a good result. But I also thought that if I keep delaying the video editing part, the publish part, I wouldn't do it at all. So after a few hours of reviewing, I decided upon a recipe (which one? surprise) and though it's far from perfect, I'll edit what I have before trying to film something else.


See you soon for more food!

Title: triggan
Excerpt:
This starts to look like a mise en abyme.  
Anyway, here you might find stuff regard this specific website.

The updates will cover functionalities and else. But let's be honest it's mostly interesting if you're interested in .NET or related development stuff!

Title: Poudr'a Patate
Excerpt:
My first card game! It all comes from a night out with some friends and trying not that interesting ideas with standard cards.

Then, I ended up creating first fules of a card game bases on **potatoes**.

And after a few years, here we are, with a fully (badly) designed game!

Title: Last Week App
Excerpt:
You like self-help habits?\
You like iterative improvement?\
You like tools?


Well, I do. I started using Ryan Hildebrandt's weekly review technic a while ago. You can learn more about my view [here](https://www.triggan.com/blog/weekly).

I will share my progress here, feel free to reach out to me if you want to try it out!
